Title: SIULIONG & CO., INC.,plaintiff-appellee,vs.PEDRO YLAGAN,defendant-appellant.
Data:
Republic of the Philippines
SUPREME COURT
Manila


EN BANC


G.R. No. L-17751             May 29, 1922


SIULIONG & CO., INC.,
 plaintiff-appellee,

vs.


PEDRO YLAGAN,
 defendant-appellant.


Manuel A. Zarcal for appellant.

Kincaid, Perkins and Kincaid for appellee. 


ROMUALDEZ, 
J.:


The defendant entered into a contract with Siuliong and Co., assignor of the plaintiff Siuliong and Co., Inc., by which the defendant promised to deliver 1,000 piculs of 
muscovado 
sugar for the class and at the price stipulated in the contract. Such delivery was to be made during the months of February and March 1920. 


The contract clearly fixes the time for the delivery of the sugar, and, therefore, no further demand or notice by the plaintiff on the defendant was necessary. 


The plaintiff, nevertheless, made a demand on the defendant for the delivery of the sugar according to the contract, but the defendant entirely failed to do so. 


The plaintiff suffered damages represented by the difference between the contract price and the amount for which the sugar would have been sold in the market during the month of February and March, 1920, which difference, according to the evidence, is P15 per picul. 


The measure of damages adopted by the court below is according to law.

Judgment is affirmed with costs against the appellant. So ordered.
